items.summary: As part of the Colts' Hispanic Heritage Month celebration, Rigoberto Sanchez read Blue's Road Trip Through Indiana in Spanish to students at Theodore Potter School 74, a dual-language immersion school in Indianapolis.

items.title: Behind Colts' record-setting offense is a sneaky roster-building foundation

items.title: Colts waive former starting LB  off injured reserve
items.summary: Per the league transaction wire, the Indianapolis Colts waived former starting linebacker Joe Bachie (foot) off of injured reserve. Signed by the Colts this past offseason to 1-year, $1.2 million deal, the former Cincinnati Bengals core special teamer reunited with defensive coordinator Lou Anarumo in Indianapolis. Only with the Colts’ lack of proven linebacker options […]

items.title: Indianapolis Colts Injury Report: CB Moore Returns To Practice
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts today released their Wednesday injury report for Week 6 of the NFL season ahead of their Sunday game against the Arizona Cardinals. Wide receiver Josh Downs missed practice today due to a concussion. Downs took a big hurt during his touchdown catch which could have been the cause of his concussion. Downs will now […]

items.title: Week 6 Film Breakdown: Colts battle for 60 Minutes vs. Arizona Cardinals
items.summary: In times like these, I remind myself that the NFL is the ultimate “week-to-week league”. It does not matter if you are 0-5 or 5-0, you can get beat every single Sunday if you aren’t at your best. If you’re an NFL fan or tune in to a press conference, you’ve heard every cliche in […]

items.title: Colts sign QB Brett Rypien to practice squad
items.summary: The Colts signed Rypien on Wednesday after placing Anthony Richardson Sr. (eye) on injured reserve earlier in the week.

items.title: Josh Downs joins Charvarius Ward in NFL’s concussion protocol

Wideout Josh Downs joined cornerback Charvarius Ward as being held out of practice with a concussion. That was expected of Ward, who [...]

items.title: Riley Leonard leaning on connection with Daniel Jones in preparing to be Colts' backup quarterback for Week 7
items.summary: Shane Steichen said Leonard will be the backup quarterback behind Jones for the Colts’ Week 7 game against the Los Angeles Chargers.

items.title: Week 6 Colts Offensive Rankings and Analysis
items.summary: Each week during the season, I will be walking through the data from the previous Colts game and analyzing the numbers to form a sort of “what happened” narrative, as well as comparing the Colts against all other teams in the league. For a glossary of the stats listed, reference Season Stats. Thanks to Pro Football Reference, NFL.com, Pro Football […]

items.title: For now, Riley Leonard is Daniel Jones’ backup; Colts signing Brett Rypien
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – The Indianapolis Colts’ quarterback picture is gaining clarity. For now. Rookie Riley Leonard is Daniel Jones’ backup for Sunday’s visit to the Los Angeles Chargers, the second straight game the sixth-round draft pick will be one play away from running the NFL’s top-scoring offense. The Colts are signing Brett Rypien to the practice [...]

items.title: How competitive can the Colts be in a suddenly less daunting AFC?
items.summary: One of the things that may have made the last 6 – 8 years of midland results somewhat bearable, is the fact that even on our good days, it was hard to see us advancing in a loaded AFC. If the beast that has been the Chiefs were going to be dethroned, it was a […]

items.title: Report: Colts signing QB Brett Rypien to practice squad
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts are signing quarterback Brett Rypien to their practice squad, according to ESPN’s Jeremy Fowler. The move comes after Indianapolis placed third-year quarterback Anthony Richardson Sr. on injured reserve Monday. According to ESPN’s Stephen Holder, Richardson “was hospitalized after a pole that he had affixed an elastic stretch band to snapped during his […]

items.title: Colts plan on signing QB Brett Rypien to practice squad
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS -- The Indianapolis Colts plan on addressing their need at quarterback by signing Brett Rypien to their practice squad on Wednesday, according to a source with knowledge of the situation. Rypien, 29, has appeared in just 11 games with four starts and 168 pass attempts with Denver, the Los Angeles Rams and Cincinnati since [...]

items.title: 5 Colts Things: Colts have No. 1 scoring offense in NFL, red zone surge continues, Josh Downs shines on key plays, Adetomiwa Adebawore comes through with important pressure late vs. Cardinals

items.title: Colts place QB Anthony Richardson Sr. on injured reserve, claim S Reuben Lowery off waivers from Ravens
items.summary: Richardson sustained a fractured orbital bone during pregame band work prior to the Colts' Week 6 game against the Arizona Cardinals.

items.title: Bill Brooks' Breakdown: How Colts overcame pregame adversity to beat Cardinals in Week 6
items.summary: Beginning this week, Colts Ring of Honor wide receiver Bill Brooks will offer his viewpoint of the Colts' most recent game, from major storylines to key plays. In this week's column, Bill looks at how the Colts handled two teammates sustaining injuries in pregame warm-ups, plus a massive play on defense in the first half.

items.title: Colts place Anthony Richardson Sr. on IR; exploring vet options at backup QB
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – The clock is ticking on Riley Leonard’s status as the Indianapolis Colts’ backup quarterback. In football lexicon, he’s day-to-day. In the aftermath of Anthony Richardson Sr. suffering a fractured orbital bone in a freak accident prior to Sunday’s 31-27 win over the Arizona Cardinals, the Colts are exploring whether a veteran quarterback would [...]

items.title: Around the AFC South: Colts in sole possession of first place in division after Jaguars loss
items.summary: The Jaguars lost to the Seahawks and the Titans lost to the Raiders on Sunday; the Texans were on a bye in Week 6.

items.title: Colts Blue Zone Podcast 432: Victory Monday as Colts Top Cardinals
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts didn't play their best but improved to 5-1 after topping the Arizona Cardinals at Lucas Oil Stadium. Matt Adams recaps the 31-27 win in the latest edition of the Colts Blue Zone Podcast. Find the Colts Blue Zone Podcast on YouTube, Apple Podcasts or Spotify.

items.title: Colts’ Riley Leonard: 1 play away instead of 2 plays away
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS — Just like that, Riley Leonard’s Sunday afternoon at the office changed. In the blink of an eye — or to be more precise, when Anthony Richardson Sr. suffered an eye injury during pre-game warm-ups — the Indianapolis Colts’ rookie quarterback saw his role altered from inactive/emergency QB to Daniel Jones’ backup. “I’m thinking, [...]

items.title: Colts find a way against Arizona, push record to AFC-best 5-1
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS — There are times things get a little more complicated — and difficult — than expected. Like when the Indianapolis Colts lost Anthony Richardson Sr. in pre-game warm-ups Sunday at Lucas Oil Stadium. The backup quarterback fractured an orbital bone in an eye when he was working with a resistance band. Like when the [...]

items.title: Colts secondary fights through adversity, comes up big when needed in win over Cardinals
items.summary: The Colts were without Charvarius Ward Sr. (concussion) and Kenny Moore II (Achilles) in Sunday's 31-27 win over the Cardinals.

items.title: Daniel Jones' preparation shines against shape-shifting Cardinals defense as Colts' offense keeps rolling
items.summary: The Arizona Cardinals rolled into downtown Indianapolis for Week 6 having not allowed more than 23 points in a game this season; the Colts needed all 31 points they scored on Sunday to improve to 5-1.

items.title: After Anthony Richardson Sr. sustains fractured orbital bone, Riley Leonard ready as Colts' backup quarterback amid difficult circumstances
items.summary: Richardson sustained a fractured orbital bone after a freak accident during pregame band work on Sunday.

items.title: Colts rally to beat Cardinals, 31-27, to improve to 5-1
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS — The Indianapolis Colts rallied from a fourth-quarter deficit to beat the Arizona Cardinals, 31-27, at Lucas Oil Stadium on Sunday afternoon to improve to 5-1. The offense scored two touchdowns in the fourth quarter, then the defense shut the door on the visitors as they drove for the go-ahead score in the final [...]

items.title: Despite depleted defense, Colts stand strong in win over Cardinals
items.summary: The Colts rallied for a 31-27 win over the Cardinals, improving to 5-1.

items.title: Sideline to Sideline: Favorite Coach
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS - Every week Blue Zone's Chris Widlic asks the Colts a question about their careers in football. This week Chris asks the players who their favorite coach has been as they've grown in the game.

items.title: Pre-game injury leaves Anthony Richardson Sr. inactive for Cardinals game
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – Anthony Richardson Sr. is inactive for Sunday’s game with the Arizona Cardinals after suffering an injury during pre-game warm-ups. The Indianapolis Colts’ backup quarterback sustained an eye injury while doing his pre-game “band work,’’ according to a team source. Rookie Riley Leonard will serve as Daniel Jones’ backup. Richardson, who lost his starting [...]

items.title: Colts announce 7 inactive players for Week 6 game vs. Arizona Cardinals
items.summary: The Colts on Friday ruled out cornerback Kenny Moore II (Achilles) and running back Tyler Goodson (groin).

It was week 16 of 2021 and the last positive moment of a season that held so much promise. Carson [...]

items.title: Raiders’ Tristin McCollum fined for hit that ended kicker Spencer Shrader’s season
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS — The play that cost Spencer Shrader the rest of the season cost Tristin McCollum $5,722. That was the fine levied against the Las Vegas Raiders safety by the NFL on Saturday. McCollum dove into the right leg of Shrader on a second-quarter PAT in the Indianapolis Colts’ 40-6 win over the Raiders last [...]

The Indianapolis Colts enter the matchup with a 4-1 record and are determined to add another notch in the win column in front of their hometown fans.  Last week, the Colts defeated the Las Vegas Raiders, while [...]

items.title: Colts' Alec Pierce cleared from concussion protocol; back to ‘feeling normal’
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – Normalcy has returned for Alec Pierce. And the Indianapolis Colts’ offense. Pierce, one of the NFL’s premier deep threats, has been cleared from the league’s concussion protocol and will return for Sunday’s meeting with the Arizona Cardinals. He’s missed the past two games after suffering a concussion in the week 3 victory at [...]

items.title: Colts rule out RB Tyler Goodson, CB Kenny Moore II for Week 6 game vs. Arizona Cardinals; WR Alec Pierce clears concussion protocol
